body: $TSLA I really thought the rug pull days were gonna be over and we'd trade more like $AAPL but I guess you gotta be more ruthless and steal from your creators, and install suicide nets at your factory  if you want that kind of stability

$SPY Now I AM STARTING TO GET IT, WHY PANIC SETTING IN, probably ERs got 0% chance even small bumps.

We headin' downANDQUICK! 

Powell, you remember said, '2,or, 3, 4, more meetings b4 1st hike, these things take time,"  yet, here was Powell's urgency to saying in same statement, ",Inglation should be back around 2-3% by end of year." 

Now, MY QUESTION is HOW & then I got an epiphany, we at 7% now, so, how in the FLIP can FED not aggressively raise rates if they have a bat's weenie chance of getting rates back to target , 2-3%?

Well, here's how, they AGGRESSIVELY DO THINGS, FEBRUARY WILL NOW BE END OF TREASURY BUYS IN MARKETS & 1st hike will be March , and, yes, bulls, listen up, aggressive means a DOUBLE HIKE. 

Now, this can give JOLTS! But, .50% is my guess for March, and, to be aggressive , they'll need to do FIVE TO SIX MORE HIK3LES IN 2023.

That's the tweet.

$QQQ $SOXX $AAPL
$AAPL I think this is nearing lows. Should hit 180 by EOM.

$AAPL 

The chart shows this is about the lowest it’s been in awhile.  I bough some at $170 -171 two weeks ago and more today at $172.25

$aapl Apple will shatter its holiday quarter earnings record despite supply issues, analyst says
https://appleinsider.com/articles/22/01/13/apple-will-shatter-its-holiday-quarter-earnings-record-despite-supply-issues-analyst-says https://appleinsider.com/articles/22/01/13/apple-will-shatter-its-holiday-quarter-earnings-record-despite-supply-issues-analyst-says

links.title: Apple will shatter its holiday quarter earnings record despite supply issues, analyst says | AppleInsider
links.description: Investment bank JP Morgan expects Apple to beat Wall Street's consensus when it reports revenue, and break its holiday quarter records, despite a hit from supply chain constraints. In a note to investors seen by AppleInsider, JP Morgan lead analyst Samik Chatterjee outlined his predictions for Apple's Q1 2022, which corresponds to the fourth calendar quarter of 2021.

links.title: 'Fortnite' returns to the iPhone through Nvidia's Geforce Now | AppleInsider
links.description: AppleInsider is supported by its audience and may earn commission as an Amazon Associate and affiliate partner on qualifying purchases. These affiliate partnerships do not influence our editorial content. Nvidia and Epic Games have announced that "Fortnite" will make its return to Apple platforms through the GeForce Now cloud streaming service, though only via web browser.
